Information expansion “Chinese encoding character set
1 This document specifies the Chinese graphic characters and the hexadecimal representation of the binary codes used in information technology.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input, and output of Chinese and other graphic character information.

This document applies to the technical class products with Chinese and other text graphics character information processing and exchange function, including but not limited to software products such as input method, optical character recognition (OCR), editing proofreading, machine translation, voice synthesis, text conversion, and Chinese writing, and convenience products such as computers, communication terminal equipment, electronic book readers, and learning machines.
2 Citation of Regulatory Documents
The following documents constitute an integral part of this document by reference to the regulations contained therein.
In this case, the reference document with the date applies only to the version corresponding to that date; the latest factory version (including all amendments) applies to the document.
GB/T 2312 1-1980 “Information Exchange Chinese Character Coding Character Set” Basic Set
GB/I 11383 1 1989 Information processing “Information exchange using eight-bit code structure and encoding rules
GB/T 13000 Information technology -- Universal character set (UCS)
3 Terminology and Definitions
the following definitions apply to this document .
3.1 Characters
An element of a set of elements that are used to organize, control, or represent data.
3.2 coded character
A character (3.1) and its encoding is shown.
3.3 Private use area
The user of the product that complies with this document can define the region.
3.4 Vocabulary repertoire
a specified character set (3.1) is represented by a code character (3.2) set .
3.5 reserved zone
Reserves for future use of the areas provided for in this document.
4 Vocabulary
4.1 Overview
the characters in this document are encoded in single @-@ byte, double @-@ byte, or quadruple @-@ byte segments .
The single-character section contains all 128 characters from GB/T 11383-1989, 0x00~0x7F.
4.3 Two-word Parts
The bi-gram part includes all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, all the CJK unified Han characters in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
The characters in the bi-character field are defined according to the rules in Appendix A.
The graphical, coded, and functional description of the symbol shall conform to the provisions of Annex B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is the unified code for Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Vietnamese characters.
Chinese characters with unique abstract shapes are assigned unique code positions; Chinese characters with different abstract shapes but the same source are assigned shared code positions.
The encoded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-word segments

The four-character segment includes the 66 CJK Unified Han characters (9FA6 to 9FEF) in GB/T 13000, excluding the 8 characters from 9FB4 to 9FBB), CJK Unified Han characters extension A, CJK Unified Han characters extension BCJK, CJK Unified Han characters extension DCJK, CJK Unified Han characters extension F, and
Characters in the four-character segment are defined as specified in Appendix C.
5 Overall structure
All numbers in the text are in hexadecimal format unless prefixed with 0x.
The representations in the appendix are all in hexadecimal, and all other numbers are in decimal.
The word segment is based on the coding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, using the code positions 0x00~0x7F.

The two-byte GOB format uses two eight-bit binary bytes to represent a character, with the first byte having the values 0x81 to 0xFE and the second byte having the values 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
the four-character segment part adopts GB/T 11383-1989 unused 0x30 0x39 as the suffix for the extension of the two-character segment encoding, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 0xFE39FE39.

9.1 General
This document specifies three levels of implementation.

The system software product that meets the corresponding implementation level should provide the input and output function of all characters within the range of the corresponding implementation level.
9.2 Achieving Level 1

Implement the level 1 composition of the CJK Unified Han Character (i.e., 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and the CJK Unified Han Character Expansion A (i.e., 0x8139EE39 to 0x82358738) in this document's single-byte encoding part, bi-season encoding
Any product covered by this document should meet the requirements for level 1.
Note: Based on the software application needs, the level 1 can also choose any one or more of the non-Chinese characters listed in Table 3.
9.3 Achieving Level 2
Level 2 includes Level 1.
Furthermore, the level 2 realization also supports the unpaired encoding of the Chinese characters in the General Standard Chinese Character Table.
The Unicode General Category Han Character Table) contains the code position and shape of the Han characters collected in this document.
the system software and supporting software shall meet the requirements for level 2 implementation .

9.4 Achieving Level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2.
Furthermore, the level 3 realization can also handle all the Chinese characters and the Kanji headings specified in this document and Table 3.

The C and C++ compilers are integrated . They both process one or more of the four steps on the input file: preprocessing , Hii (compilation) , (assembly) MERE (linking) .
The suffixes in the source file name identify the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the suffixes control the default settings:
gcc treats the preprocessed file (.i) as a C file and sets up the connection in C format,
g++ treats the preprocessed file (.i) as a C++ file and sets up the connection in C++ style.
The source file suffix indicates the language type and the postprocessing:
.c C source program; preprocessing, compilation, and assembly
.C C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, assembly
.cc C++ source code; preprocessing, compilation, and assembly
. CXX C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, assembly
.m Objective-C source program; preprocessing, compilation, and linking
.i  preprocessed C file; compile, assemble
.ii Preprocessed C++ files; compile, assemble
.s Compiler source program; compile
Compiling the Source Language Program; Preprocessing, Compiling

To use this option successfully, you must mark #pragma implementation (define) or #pragma interface (declare) in all files that use the template.
When the program is compiled with `-fexternal-templates ', all template instantiations are external types. You must have the required instantiations appear in the implementation file.
This can be achieved by typedefing the required instances.
Correspondingly, if the default option `-fno-extern-templates' is used at compile time, all template instances that are explicitly set are set to internal.
All member functions (except constructors and the mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual functions of their class.
This does not imply that every call to a member function will go through the internal virtual function table.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a particular function can be called directly; in this case, it calls the function directly.

The merging of user defined free storage management into c++ makes the assignable `this' look out of place.
Therefore, by default, the internal this assignment in the class member function is a no-op.
However, for backward compatibility, you can make this operation effective by the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char  define char as unsigned type, like unsigned char.
All machines have their own default char type, which is either unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, when the symbolic representation of data is dependent, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.

However, many programs are already written to use only simple chars, and this is the case with the street numbers (or without symbols, depending on the target machine on which the program is written).
This option, and its opposite, makes such a program work with the corresponding default value.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it behaves exactly like one of them.
If no `signed' or "unsigned' modifier is explicitly declared, these options define a signed or unsigned bit field.

By default, the fields are symbolic because they inherit from the basic integer types, such as int, which are symbolic integers, but if you specify the `-traditional' option, the fields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments and does not do any special handling.
This is to support some old programs, which consider the string constant a very bad idea, and the `-traditional' option has the same effect.
Executing the summary
COVID-19 's impact on the drug market
The impact could be similar to the 2008 financial crisis.
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, the disease has overwhelmed health services and brought them to the brink of collapse, and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused severe disruptions to the global economy.
The impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
some producers may be forced to find new ways to make drugs because the restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and essential chemicals .
Traffickers may have to find new routes and methods as they are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions.
The patterns of drug use and supply are likely to change, and the government's ability to respond may be hampered.
The pandemic has brought about unprecedented changes, but we can still learn from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis , some drug users began to seek out cheaper synthetic substances , and their use patterns shifted toward injection drug use .
At the same time, governments have cut drug-related budgets.
Preventive interventions and drug treatment services could be severely affected if governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way.
In addition, the priority of interception operations and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Some countries have a significant amount of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and these countries are expected to be the most directly affected by drug trafficking activities.

Messengers are carrying methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs in their bags or in their luggage , sometimes in large quantities . With restrictions on air travel almost everywhere , the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs is likely to be completely disrupted .
Although the international postal supply chain has also been disrupted, activities involving the use of the dark web and parcel post for trafficking may increase.
In the long run, the economic recession and related lockdown measures could disrupt the drug market.

Rising unemployment and lack of opportunities will make poor and vulnerable populations more likely to use drugs in harmful ways, develop drug dependence and turn to illicit drug activities, whether as producers or traffickers.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of these situations to offer services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members.
As government capacity is reduced, these changes could quickly take hold and become the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and Complexity
Market growth
population growth patterns partly explain the expansion of markets
Drug abuse is increasing worldwide, both in terms of the overall number of drug abusers and the proportion of the world 's population that is abusing drugs.

the number of drug users was estimated to be 210 million in 2009 , accounting for 4.8 % of the global population aged 15 to 64 years , and 269 million in 2018 , accounting for 5.3 % of this population .
over the past two decades , the growth of drug abuse in developing countries has far outpaced that in developed countries .

This reflects, to some extent, the difference in overall population growth between developed countries, which grew by 7%, and developing countries, which grew by 28%, but also reflects the faster growth of the young population in developing countries.
the largest proportion of drug users are adolescents and young adults .
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group grew by 16% in developing countries and fell by 10% in developed countries.
1 urbanization is a driving factor of the current and future drug markets
in both developed and developing countries , urban areas have higher rates of drug abuse than rural areas .

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the massive rural to urban migration of the population. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared with 34% in 1960.
urbanization is likely to be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market , particularly in developing countries where urbanization is more pronounced .

the increase in wealth is associated with an increase in drug use , but the burden of disease is greatest among the poorest people worldwide , and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries .
Cocaine and other drugs are also more firmly linked to the world's wealthier regions.
similarly , within countries , the prevalence of drug use is higher among the socially affluent .
but the rate of conversion to drug @-@ induced illness is higher among those with lower socioeconomic status .
data from a few countries suggest that the association between harmful drug use patterns and disease is linked to low income .
these patterns do not seem to be common in wealthier social classes .
The economic constraints of the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment rates, have been linked to increased drug use in the past, and the pandemic has already forced hundreds of millions of people worldwide out of work.

The pandemic could lead to further expansion of the drug market. The pandemic could lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illicit crop cultivation, either because of reduced state control or because of the economic crisis, which could lead more people to engage in illicit activities.

The restrictions related to COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land traffic, which has likely led to an increase in maritime smuggling, which is less risky and more numerous than air or land smuggling.
Recently, there have been reports that cocaine cargoes are being shipped directly from South America to Europe via sea routes.
Complexity Enhancement

The availability of non-internationally controlled substances has stabilized, but there is an increase in the number of new types of opioids with potential for harm, and the drug market is becoming more complex.
Hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added to the mix, many of them not under international control, and the nonmedical use of pharmaceuticals is also on the rise.
There are about 500 new active substances in the domestic market of member countries every year.
at present , most are stimulants , followed by synthetic cannabinoid agonists and small amounts of opioids .
Although the total number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized , the proportion of substances has changed .
Of the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, only 2 % were new psychoactive substances of the opioid type , but by 2018 this figure had risen to 9 %.

Many of the new psychoactive substances that are fentanyl analogues have been shown to be effective and dangerous , causing overdose deaths in North America and elsewhere , albeit to a lesser extent .
In North America, fentanyl is used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs ( including cocaine and methamphetamine ) and as a component in counterfeit prescription opioids .

evidence of injection of new psychoactive substances of abuse in Europe has emerged : a study of waste @-@ syringe @-@ remnants in six European cities found that many syringes contained new psychoactive substances of abuse that produced stimulant effects .
the use of novel psychoactive substances is likely to become entrenched in vulnerable populations over time .
Single-species new psychoactive substances have rarely formed large markets.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among marginalized groups such as the homeless and prison inmates.
twenty @-@ two countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons , with most countries citing synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge .
Controls on precursor chemicals have forced innovation. Many chemicals used to synthesize fentanyl, methamphetamine, and "club drugs" have been placed under international controls.

Drug traffickers and manufacturers have been looking for alternatives to controlled substances, not only those with less regulation, but also chemicals designed to evade regulation, known as "designer precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at halting the spread of COVID-19 are likely to further squeeze the drug makers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this has become a reality: in March 2020, a shortage of methylphenidate precursors imported from East Asia reportedly led to price increases for methylphenidate in Mexico and the United States.
The market is changing rapidly.
Synthetic opioids replace heroin in Central Asia and Russian Federation
the opioid market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appeared to have undergone changes between 2008 and 2018 .
the number of opioids seized by Russian authorities has fallen by about 80 % , and the number of people treated for opioid use disorders has dropped significantly .
But the market for stimulants appears to be growing.
evidence suggests that methamphetamine and various cathinones , including methcathinone and a -phenoxypentylphenethylamine , are now widely available on the Russian drug market .
Russian authorities reported a sharp rise in the number of secret laboratories producing various illicit drugs, which more than doubled in two years, to 152 in 2018.
Afghanistan and Iraq Methamphetamine Markets Grow
The importance of methamphetamine in Iraq was already revealed in 2012 by surveys of hospital, prison and other institutional staff.
Crystal methamphetamine has become a third major drug of concern , in addition to " ecstasy " and ketamine .
These findings were further confirmed by a 2015 study, which found that cannabis users reported greater difficulty obtaining cannabis than heroin or methamphetamine.

Recently , the authorities in Iraq have discovered several methamphetamine laboratories , and the International Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about large imports of ephedrine , which is used as a precursor in the manufacture of methamphetamine .
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine manufacture appears to have begun in 2014.
since then , seizures of methamphetamine have steadily increased .
But the seizure volume in the first half of 2019 was 657 kg, which was a sharp increase compared with the previous year.
The large seizures of methamphetamine in other countries that are believed to have originated in Afghanistan also indicate that the country's production is rising rapidly.
Policy changes and trends
the majority of jurisdictions that have legalized marijuana for non @-@ medical use have seen an increase in marijuana use .
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay, and the United States allow the production of cannabis products for nonmedical use.

in most jurisdictions , there has been an increase in cannabis use since it was legalized , although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized nonmedical cannabis use .

In Colorado and Washington, the two states that first legalized marijuana for adult use, the number of people who use the drug without a medical reason has increased, particularly in the past month and on a daily or near daily basis, surpassing the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that since 2011, marijuana use in Uruguay has increased, with the number of users almost doubling in the last month.
this suggests that the increased risk is primarily due to frequent and regular use of cannabis .
Short-term data from Canada also shows that the increase in legal market size from 2018 to 2019 was accompanied by increased use.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products from illegal sources.
Is the reason for the global drop in the seizure of cannabis herb legalization?
Global cannabis herb seizures fell to their lowest level in 20 years in 2018, with seizures in North America falling by 84% over the past decade.

By contrast, seizures in other parts of the world nearly doubled over the same period. The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at loosening the marijuana market have played a key role in the decline.
the regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have had a deterrent effect , but the effect of regulation on new psychoactive substances in China is still difficult to assess .
countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances show different prevalence of use of new psychoactive substances .
in other countries , the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation .
the use of opioids for pain management and palliative care is unevenly distributed across regions , with the therapeutic opioids primarily available in high @-@ income countries .
in 2018 , more than 90 % of all opioids available for medical consumption were in high @-@ income countries .
About 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries account for about 12% of the world's population.
an estimated 88 % of the world 's population resides in low @-@ and middle @-@ income countries , but less than 10 % of the world 's opioid consumption is in these countries .
Obstacles to obtaining opioids are related to many factors , including legislation , culture , the health system , and prescribing practices .
poorer people are at greater risk of developing the disease , which affects an estimated 35.6 million people worldwide .

poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase the risk of and exacerbate the consequences of drug use disorders . This has been confirmed in studies in high @-@ income countries , where the social @-@ economic trajectory of individuals is associated not only with their status at a given point in time but also with the risk of drug use disorders .

the social and economic disadvantages associated with addiction are compounded by the risk of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , which in turn perpetuate the cycle of disadvantage . These outcomes may also be related to stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system .

women , ethnic and migrant minorities , sexual and gender diverse groups , people displaced by armed conflict or disasters , and people living in rural settings may also be disproportionately affected by drug @-@ related illnesses or face problems accessing treatment services .

the adverse effects of drug abuse on society have been magnified over the past decade , according to the disability @-@ adjusted life years ( DALY ) indicator , which estimates the number of years of healthy life lost because of disability and premature death .
from 2007 to 2018 , the global disability @-@ adjusted life expectancy increased by 17 % as a result of drug use .

the magnitude of the adjustment in life expectancy years for the associated disability was particularly high for untreated hepatocellular carcinoma caused by hepatitis C in injection drug users , ranging from 40 % to 60 % .
the relationship between drugs and violence is complex , and it is difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychostimulants and violence .
limited data from around the world suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicides .
But in violent incidents, alcohol seems to play a larger role than drugs.

Although drug use may lead to criminal behavior , in some cases , this association can be partially attributed to multiple mediators , such as socioeconomic disadvantage , and other types of adversity , such as those influenced by individual risk , family environment , and peers .
The connection between drug dealing and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, large-scale organized criminal activities, including international drug trafficking, can be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the existence and intensity of violence are more dependent on changes that destabilize the balance of power between organized criminal groups, such as changes in the size of the illicit market, the death or imprisonment of well-known criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group relative to another.
Latest Trends
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance, and opioids are the most dangerous.
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug in the world.
By comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
but the associated harms of opioids are often overlooked because they are less commonly used .

of the estimated 167,000 deaths related to drug use in 2017 , 66 % were caused by these substances , and 50 % of the estimated 21 million years of life lost due to disability or premature death attributable to drug use were caused by these substances .
Synthetic opioid misuse exacerbates public health crisis

in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa , ketamine is the drug of choice for exacerbating the opioid crisis ; in North America , it is fentanyl . The two regions have almost nothing in common in terms of economic , demographic , or general drug use patterns , but they are both struggling with the opioid crisis , which is fueled by the availability and low cost of production of these substances .
in North America , the use of synthetic opioids , including fentanyl , has led to a 20 @-@ year increase in opioid overdose deaths .
In 2018, two thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths in the United States involved fentanyl.
a similar result was reported in canada , but with lower numbers .
part of the reason for the overdose deaths is the unpredictable effects of the fentanyl in the illicit drug market .
In West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa , the market for nonmedical use of khat has grown substantially .
in the region , more and more Qomadōs are being treated for the disease .
In 2017, the global seizure of cocaine increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law regulating ketamine, global seizures dropped to 32 tons.
The crisis in both places was fueled by the manufacture of simple and cheap products, and by the lack of international regulation of ketamine and many other opioids.
The crisis in both places is compounded by the fact that these substances are available on both the pharmaceutical and the illicit markets, making it difficult to detect and prevent their abuse.
Use of stimulants continues to rise
The cocaine and methamphetamine markets are the largest in the stimulant field, and both substances are increasing in use in their primary markets.
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, as cocaine is prevalent in North America and Western Europe.
an estimated 27 million people used amphetamines in 2016 , with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America .
based on the majority of indicators , methamphetamine use has been expanding in both regions for the past 20 years .

in some markets , cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist and sometimes substitute for each other , with the use of one drug rising as the use of the other falls and sometimes both increasing and decreasing to meet the same market demand .
COVID @-@ 19 increases risk for injecting drug users
an estimated 11.3 million people injected drugs in 2018 , and about 10 % of global HIV infections were attributed to injecting drug use .
More than 1 million injection drug users are infected with HIV, and 5.5 million have hepatitis C.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died from drug overdoses, half of them from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, which is still largely untreated among people who inject drugs.

the shortage of opioids caused by COVID @-@ 19 restrictions may lead to users substituting with more readily available substances , such as alcohol or benzodiazepines , or mixing opioids with synthetic drugs .
with some users switching to injection or injecting more frequently , there may be more harmful use .

EU summit debates refugee policy, EU official: reception process is bottlenecked - ECNS
EU summit struggles with migrant policy, EU official says every step of the process is a bottleneck

[Global Times reporter: Niu Rifeng in Belgium] According to a report by AFP on February 10, at the latest EU summit, the President of the European Commission, Von der Leyen, said that the EU leaders agreed to issue stricter policies on illegal immigration, which would make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.
The move by the EU is in response to growing concerns over illegal immigration in Europe, where the number of people who can ultimately be sent back is small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member countries have been arguing over the cost of the fence.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But some diplomats from member states said that if the EU could share the installation of cameras, observation towers and other infrastructure along the external border, it would free up national budgets and speed up the construction process.

The EU's refugee reception system is in a "permanent crisis," EU officials have admitted, with bottlenecks at every stage of the process, limited capacity and overstretched migration authorities in member states unable to stop refugees from making "countless" asylum claims across the bloc.
The EU Commission estimates that the Schengen countries of the EU received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of almost half compared to the previous year.
Meanwhile, the EU recorded more than 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.
In this context, the summit also agreed on a "principle" that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants back to their home countries based on a court ruling of another member state.
In addition, the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries," which will pave the way for the EU to establish a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Niu Rifeng)
The United States has upgraded the "chip war" and has severely damaged the global semiconductor industry - Ecns.cn

Recently, the United States has been escalating its “chip war” with China - first, the Netherlands and Japan, under pressure from the United States, agreed to launch controls on the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China; then, foreign media reported that the US government is considering cutting off all links between US suppliers and Huawei, and prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to

In recent years, the United States has never stopped its actions to suppress China's "chip" development. On the one hand, it has accurately suppressed the semiconductor supply chain in China. On the other hand, it has built an alliance of semiconductor industry chains to "de-China" in the semiconductor industry. It aims to "completely overtake" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to attract South Korea to establish a “technology alliance” or to establish a “four-way alliance” with South Korea, Japan and Taiwan, or to establish a “semiconductor industry chain” through the “Quad mechanism” and the “Indo-Pacific Economic Framework” of the United States, Japan, India and Australia, the United States aims to build a closed supply chain cycle dominated by the United States, thereby making up
However, the United States's overly exaggerated "chip warfare" against China is also "injuring the enemy while losing 800 of our own".

Recently, the Linyi Group, a well-known chip manufacturing equipment supplier in the United States, announced that the company would lay off 1,300 full-time employees and 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters due to the impact of the latest round of export bans on Chinese chip manufacturing equipment.

The Dutch ASML, the world's largest semiconductor lithography equipment manufacturer, recently warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

According to the analysis of the American media, after the US government imposed a sweeping crackdown on the semiconductor and other industries in China, many American companies were severely affected, including developers of electronic design automation tools, chip designers, manufacturers of semiconductor manufacturing equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The United States claims to suppress China's advanced semiconductor industry, but it has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has already formed a closely linked global semiconductor industry chain.

According to the estimation of professionals, based on the professional division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross the border of more than 70 countries, and the whole process takes 100 days.

Although the United States has a strong semiconductor industry, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technologies, and is heavily dependent on the East Asian region.

Even if the United States is eager to lead the advanced chip supply chain to the “small circle” regional development dominated by the United States, the regional distribution and mutual dependence of the global semiconductor industry will be difficult to change.
The United States has been vigorously “re-shaping” the “de-China” semiconductor industry chain, and has re-created the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future industry in the world, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the joint participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively promulgated the Innovation and Competition Act, the 2022 US Competition Act, and the Chips and Science Act, using technological hegemony to consolidate its technological superiority; it has used “authority and favor” to coerce Intel, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company, and Samsung, among other
In the short term, the United States has indeed created trouble for the development of China's chip industry and related industries, and has reaped real benefits.

In the long run, however, the United States’ relentless suppression and forcing China’s chip industry to continuously break through will cause the United States to lose a huge Chinese market, ultimately weakening the innovation willingness and innovation ability of US technology companies, and harming the development of the global chip industry.

First batch of personal pension investment products launched, with the shortest holding period of 360 days - chinanews.com
First batch of personal pension investment products on sale
Seven products can be selected from the home institution, and the shortest can only hold 360 days.
Personal pension investment products have finally been launched.

On February 10, China Finance Network released the first list of personal pension investment products, and the 7 personal pension investment products of Guangdong Development Bank, Agricultural Bank of China and China Postal Savings were officially launched.

At present, the “shelf” of personal pension accounts has finally been filled with four types of products, namely personal pension savings, personal pension investment, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public funds.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension investment products are all publicly offered net asset value open-end products, of which 5 are new products and 2 are existing products, and except for one product which is a mixed type product, the other 6 products are all fixed income type products.

The Beijing Youth Daily reporter found that of the five new products, four were from Industrial Bank Wealth Management, all of which were fixed income products, with the shortest holding period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% -

The remaining new product is "Postal Savings Wealth Enrichment Huangjing 1095 Days 1", which is also a fixed income product, and the subscription began on February 10 and ended on February 19, with a risk level of two.

Among the two surviving products, one is Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management’s “Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management - Innovative 360-Day RMB Wealth Management Product”, which is an investment product of mixed type with a risk level of three.

Another surviving product is "Postal Savings Wealth Enrichment Qianjin Huangjing 1st 365 Days", a fixed income type, which began to raise funds on December 30 last year and officially started operating on January 4 this year, with a cumulative net value of 1.0011 on February 8.

According to the Opinions of the State Council Office on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension, the funds in the individual pension account can be invested in financial products such as bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, publicly-traded funds, and so on.
The first personal pension investment products were sold, marking the official launch of personal pension investors’ ability to purchase investment products through personal pension fund accounts.
In November last year, the SAFE established the Interim Provisions on the Management of Individual Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Securities Companies.

The Measures stipulate that participants can purchase personal pension products through their personal pension fund accounts, including personal pension savings, personal pension investment products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice, which clarified that the individual pension system would be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Hebei Shijiazhuang, and the Xiongan New Area, and Jinzhong City in Shanxi Province.
By the end of 2022, the number of participants in personal pensions was 19.54 million, and the number of payers was 61.3 million, with a total of RMB14.2 billion in payments.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot only launched three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public funds.
Now that the personal pension investment products have gathered, how should investors choose?

Experts from the research and development department of ICBC Wealth Management said that compared with other personal pension products, the pilot stage of pension wealth management products and personal pension wealth management products have three characteristics.

First, it is safe and sound. The risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and concept are more sound, and the third party independent custody is implemented by non-banking institutions.

Secondly, it is long-term. The trial period of the long-term care investment products is 5 years or more. The holding period of the next issued personal long-term care investment products is 1 year as a minimum, and holding for more than 3 years is encouraged.

Third, it is universal. The product purchase threshold is low, and the purchase point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The custody fee, management fee, and other fees are more favorable.
Experts pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the products and their own risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of long-term, high interest rates, and high safety, which are suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on guarantees, which are suitable for people who cannot afford investment risks and can accept stable returns; personal pension investment products and publicly-traded fund products do not guarantee returns, have certain investment risks, but have higher expected returns, which are suitable for people with certain

The fitness industry should get rid of the crisis of trust - chinanews.com
Another large gym “bombs”?
Recently, the famous fitness institution, Zhongjing Fitness Club, has been the focus of public attention due to its member’s rights protection issues.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally. Subsequently, rumors about the closure and running away of the organization caused members to panic, leading to the involvement of public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization responded and promised to strive to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the storm was finally calmed down.

Some gyms have temporarily closed some of their branches due to operational problems. Consumers could have waited calmly for the problems to be solved. Why is the first reaction of many members “this is bad news”?
The fitness club member protection storm is a deep-seated problem of industry trust crisis.
Domestic traditional gyms generally adopt the prepaid model, and “making money from users who do not come” is the underlying logic of its development.

Through the pre-sale of membership cards to obtain cash flow, opening new stores continuously, it seems to be cyclical, but in fact it is eating the food of the ox, and it is impossible to form a stable profit model.
The negative news of gyms closing and running out of stock frequently appeared, which had a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the market prospect, gym is certainly a good business with "money path".
The fitness track has ups and downs, but it has always been the focus of capital.
According to multiple data, the heat in the fields of literature and art consumption and other areas is rising, and the market is recovering.

In the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents’ living standards, the concept of healthy life has entered people’s hearts, and the development of the fitness industry has great potential.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the development of quality.

However, some institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumption, and just come out of the crisis, and blow the horn of opening up new territories, and invest the financing funds in the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in recent years, many institutions have withdrawn due to the impact of the epidemic, and the industry has been re-branded. At this time, powerful enterprises have selectively increased their acquisition strength and re-deployed, and there is no shortage of new opportunities.

However, if the fitness market is to develop and enter into a virtuous cycle, and move towards a stable and prosperous future, the industry must change its traditional model and change its operating strategy.
Only by solidifying and rebuilding the consumer's trust and sense of security can we truly win the market and win the future.
Compared with the market share of new stores, the fitness industry currently needs to calm down and optimize services, and use high-quality development to stabilize users.
First, we need to rely on services to retain users.
The gym belongs to the service industry, and its essence is to adhere to the “user-oriented”, to closely surround the user’s needs, and to focus on the quality and upgrading of services.
Secondly, digital transformation should be used to improve user experience.
For example, the current popular Internet gym model, which realizes user pay-per-use and site selection.
At the same time, the body data and the movement data can be effectively utilized, and the social needs can be satisfied, realizing the complete service loop from online to offline.
Without private coaching and large annual fees, users’ concerns about gyms “running away” with their money are reduced, and their trust in the gym is increased.
In addition, we must actively explore multiple business forms.

Now, sports consumption has moved from single services to scene consumption, and fitness clubs are expected to become a new entry point for consumption. Surrounding products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment that are needed for fitness are expected to become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choices.
Gong Tianjie
Buy expensive and get a discount!
Nanjing Real Estate Market Reappears “Price Difference Compensation” - Ecns.cn

Yangzhou Evening News (reporter: Ma Zhupo) Yangzhou Evening News / Zhuoxin News reporter found in an interview on the 10th that the “price guarantee agreement” that has not been seen for more than ten years has returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A real estate project in the Jiangbei New Area claimed “price compensation”, and the discount of other real estate resources was greater than the previous discount
The conditions of the “price-fixing agreement” are not few.
The apartment complex in Jiangbei New District is called Yanzhou Yunyu, and the buyer, Mr. Sun, told the reporter that he found a “statement” when he visited the apartment complex last weekend.

The developer of the property promised in the photos he sent to the reporter that if the buyer bought the property between February 1 and February 28, the developer would replace the property and return the difference in price if the buyer had bought a property with a better discount than the previous property (limited to other unsold properties of the same type, floor, unit, and property type as the property).

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was actually a “price maintenance agreement”. The purpose was to reassure the buyer that he did not have to worry about the developer’s price reduction promotion. “Now I’m afraid that after buying it, it will be reduced in price, and I will have no time to go to the sales office to make trouble. If I don’t make trouble, it will be a real trouble. ”
Many buyers also believe that the “price maintenance agreement” is a “placebo” for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who intends to buy a house in Jiangbei, said that the house she wants to buy is a house that is urgently needed. The house must be the same type, in the same building, in the same unit, and there are very few houses that buyers can compare. Therefore, the “threshold” is still high.
Some buyers also believe that because of the information asymmetry, the sales may give extra discounts, and it is not easy for buyers to “fight for their rights”.
Whether the buyers can stay in the house is to be observed.

The reporter found on the Nanjing online real estate website that the project sold 252 units in two buildings in November last year, with floor areas of 105 square meters, 114 square meters, and 129 square meters, and the average selling price of fully furnished units was RMB 39,843 per square meter.

However, more than two months have passed, and the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is currently 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 8 units in total, 128 units, accounting for 113 units, and 44 units of 124 units in 7 units have not been sold, and the total number of transactions in the project is only 33 units
Market insiders said that the "price maintenance agreement" also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the apartment project Lugu West Garden on Huangshan Road in Hexi District launched a “price guarantee plan” to attract buyers. The specific content was that “the company solemnly promises that if the project’s discount range is expanded within one year, the company will return the difference to the old owners according to the difference”.
After that, in April 2011, nine projects in Nanjing also promised to pay the difference in price for a portion of their properties.
"The property market is recovering, and we need a "strong medicine" at this time.
"The price-fixing agreement is also one of the marketing methods of real estate companies. "Shen, a senior real estate operator in Nanjing, said.
He believes that developers now need more confidence than buyers, and the launch of the “price guarantee agreement” is actually to boost their confidence.
As for whether the buyers can stay, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as the regulatory policies and the loan threshold, and it is still to be observed.
Multiple data decline, Taiwan's economic performance in the first quarter of the year is not good - EIN News

Xinhua News Agency Taipei on February 11 (correspondents: Zhao Bo, Huang Yang) The export trade volume has been in a “five-year low”, the manufacturing purchasing managers index (PMI) has been contracting for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) has seen “three-digit” figures... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released economic data for January 2023
Experts believe that Taiwan's economy has performed poorly in the first year, and the growth pressure is not small.

According to the financial affairs department of the Taiwan authorities, the exports of Taiwan region in January this year were US $ 3.151 billion, a year-on-year decrease of 21.2%, and the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export volume of 11 major export commodities declined year on year.
Rubber and its products and optical instruments fell the most, with a year-on-year decline of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
The export of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year on year, which is the largest decline in the past 11 years.
Among them, integrated circuits fell by 18.3% year-on-year, the largest decline in 14 years.
The statistics chief of the department, Cai Meina, said that this showed the weakening effect of consumer electronics industry demand, and the electronics industry was entering a correction period.
Statistics show that in January, the import and export of Taiwan region fell by double digits, and the excess gold was only US $2.34 billion, which was the lowest level in nearly three years.

The Taiwan authorities' financial affairs department believes that the global terminal demand is reduced, the industry adjusts the inventory to suppress the willingness of manufacturers to purchase raw materials, and the export slump is difficult to improve in the short term. Taiwan's exports in the first quarter of this year are likely to decline more than expected.

According to the Taiwan Economic Research Institute, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Manager Index (PMI) in January was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment, down 3.3 percentage points from December last year, and has been contracting for seven consecutive months.
In the economic monitoring indicator system, PMI is 50% as the glory line, and the index is greater than 50%, which represents the expansion of the economy, and vice versa is contraction.
In January, Taiwan's PMI five component indicators showed that new orders, production and human resources were tight, suppliers' delivery time was shortened, and inventory was tight.

All six industries reported contraction in PMI, and the industries were ranked in order of contraction speed as the electricity and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), the electronic and optical industry (35.2%), the chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%), the basic raw material industry (42.4%), the transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and the food and textile industry (45.
In terms of prices, the "Financial Bureau" of the Taiwan authorities announced that the CPI of Taiwan in January this year was 3.04%, which has exceeded 3% since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables rose by 28.25%, which was the highest in 17 months.

Zhao Zhongheng, a special commissioner of the Taiwan “Financial Bureau”, frankly admitted that the price increase of vegetables was indeed beyond expectations. Excluding the factors of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February of this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year. Inflation pressure still exists and is still at a high point.
Looking ahead to Taiwan's economy this year, experts are pessimistic, according to reports by domestic media including United Daily News and Yahoo Finance.

Professor Wu Daoren of the Economics Department of the “Central University” in Taiwan analyzed that the export decline may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturers, and the risk of debt default will rise.
At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of labor costs by manufacturers, which affects the labor market and the family economy, and in turn affects the consumption capacity.

According to Kuo Dasheng, a researcher at the Taiwan Economic Research Institute, the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved, and the demand continues to shrink, and it is estimated that the decline in Taiwan's exports will continue into the first half of the year.
As Taiwan's economy relies on exports, the low export performance will affect the overall economic growth in the year.

Report: The number of overseas students returning home to seek employment in 2022 will reach a new high - chinanews.com
2022 graduates seeking employment in China from abroad, top 10 countries of study. Source: “2022 Chinese Returning Home Employment Survey Report”

ECNS Beijing February 11 (Meng Ru) The “2022 Chinese Returning Home Employment Survey Report” (hereinafter referred to as “Report”) released recently shows that the scale of 2022 graduates has increased by 8.6% year-on-year, the number of returning students seeking employment has reached a new high, and the demand for overseas talents by Chinese enterprises has also increased.

The report shows that since 2020, the number of overseas Chinese returning to China to seek employment has increased significantly, and the number of graduates returning to China to seek employment has increased.
Compared with 2021, the size of the 2022 graduates increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of graduates returning home to seek employment reached a new high.

In terms of the distribution of returnees seeking employment among the countries where they studied, the United Kingdom had the highest proportion, at 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), which were ranked in the same order as in 2021.
In terms of the growth rate, the number of graduates from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore increased significantly in 2022, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7% respectively.
The number of graduates from Canada, Germany, the United States, and Australia has decreased compared with the previous year.
Trends in the Supply and Demand of Talent in the First Week After the Spring Festival in 2023. Source: “2022 China Returned Overseas Talent Employment Survey Report”

The survey shows that 58% of the students who decided to return home believed that “life is more convenient in China”, 40% decided to return home because “they are more in line with the cultural environment in China”, 32% believed that “there are more job opportunities in China”, and 22% believed that the economic activities in China will accelerate and they will have more job opportunities.
Data shows that the current domestic enterprises’ demand for overseas talents is rapidly released, and the demand for returning talents is on the rise.

In the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023, the number of priority positions and the number of Haier people seeking employment in the domestic market both showed an upward trend, with the number of priority positions for Haier increasing by 11% on February 3 and the number of Haier people seeking employment increasing by 27%.

In terms of industries, in 2022, the number of positions in the education/training industry accounted for 27.8% of the preferred positions, ranking first, followed by professional services/consulting and Internet/e-commerce industries with 14.3% and 11.1%, respectively.
The number of overseas returnees who have applied for jobs in China has changed in recent years. Source: 2022 China Returned Overseas Talents Employment Survey Report

In terms of salary, the average recruitment salary of the preferred positions of returning to the sea has been rising for three consecutive years, reaching RMB14,680/month in 2022 (RMB, below), an increase of RMB961 from RMB13,719/month in 2021, an increase of 7%.

In terms of regions, the willingness of the returning overseas Chinese to develop in new first-tier cities, second-tier cities and third-tier cities and below has increased in 2022, with the proportion of submissions in 2022 being 31%, 15.7% and 14.3% respectively, which are all higher than the proportion of submissions in 2021.
Regarding the gains from studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said they were basically in line with their expectations, up 2.8 percentage points from the previous year (49.9%).
Twenty-eight percent of those who returned to the sea said they were above or far above their expectations, which is higher than the 25.4 percent in 2021.

Henan Province Regulates Integration of Prices of Oral Implant Medical Services - Ecns.cn
CCTV News: Dental implants are the ideal choice for many tooth loss patients, but the price of tens of thousands of yuan per tooth has always made many patients hesitate.
Since this year, with the accelerated landing of the collection of implant teeth, various places have also put the reduction of implant teeth on the agenda.

From February 10, the price of the whole process of the medical service of the single conventional planting dental is controlled to be 4300 yuan, and the whole process of the single conventional planting fee is no more than 97% of the control target.
implantation of teeth refers to a method of replacing missing teeth based on the insertion of a lower structure into the bone tissue to support and fix the upper teeth.
The reporter learned from Zhengzhou University Affiliated Hospital that, for example, the price of a single conventional graft is about 16,700 yuan.
Patient He Wei: After the new policy, the doctor told me that the cost of my condition is about 8,000 yuan, less than 10,000 yuan, and I can save about half.

On the basis of existing projects, Henan Province has also integrated and determined 15 items of pricing for oral implant-related medical services, including “implant body insertion fee (single)”, and has unified the pricing for public medical institutions under the provincial government and the medical insurance payment category, and has canceled or adjusted 20 items of pricing for medical services, including dental implant surgery.

Li Yunjie, Director of the Pharmaceutical Price and Tendering Procurement Department of Zhengzhou Municipal Health Insurance Bureau: The main beneficiaries are the four parties: the insurance, the hospital, the patient, and the supplier. The insurance has less expenditure; the hospital has less pressure; the patient will be appropriately increased; the supplier has a market; and the patient is the biggest beneficiary

The emergence of “new variables” in China’s e-commerce industry has brought about a “content is king” approach to delivery.
-China News Service
China News Service, February 11 (Reporter: Liu Xiaoyu) - Subject: The emergence of "new variables" in China's e-commerce industry, how to make "content king" in delivery?
China News Service reporter Xia Bin
“We were late to the e-commerce game, but from the beginning we realized that content was going to be important if we were going to stand out from the millions of other stores.

Fangfang, a “90s” girl from Guangdong, now operates a store selling healthy food ingredients on TikTok’s e-commerce platform, allowing a brick-and-mortar store with more than 30 years of history to “bloom” online.
She imitated the style of old Hong Kong movies, sang classic Cantonese songs, and opened her account on Douyin, a video-sharing app, with beautiful videos that were a breath of fresh air.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce “Find Peers·Quality Content Sharing Special Event”, Fangfang, as a representative of quality creators, spoke on the stage and shared her experience and insights on daily creative work.

She said on the spot: "The carefully polished video has attracted the attention of many netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my family, and want to cook with me, and the sales have suddenly opened up. "
Fangfang used the video to make more people love the "old Guangzhou taste". A live broadcast sold up to 300,000 pieces of nourishing ingredients, saving the family's store from imminent bankruptcy.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short video and live e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early days of live streaming e-commerce, live streaming rooms often used low-priced discounts to attract users, and price advantages seemed to be the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, there have been many phenomenal Vs such as Liu Yahong and Dongfang Zhanxian, as well as many lesser-known experts and merchants who have emerged in vertical niches. They have improved their long-term operating efficiency by continuously creating high-quality content that is consistent with their brand image.

Haoyu Xie, the operation manager of Kuaishou’s e-commerce stars, said that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have transformed their content through Kuaishou’s e-commerce, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and the total turnover has more than doubled.
"Behind these numbers, we can feel a thriving, vibrant author ecosystem.
"Gao Yaheng said.

The Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform of Beijing Normal University has previously released the “E-commerce Industry Content Ecology Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzes the importance of “new variables” - quality content - in the current e-commerce industry from a data perspective, and uses the index to evaluate the content ecology of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ranking of the content ecology health index of the e-commerce industry in the above report, the top five are TikTok, Huoshan, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com.

The report believes that the content ecology in the e-commerce industry is an integrated concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce, only good PGC (professional content production) and UGC (user original content) are the quality carrier to integrate with e-commerce, the content platform value is higher, the consumption and promotion scene is richer, the possibility of e-commerce integration is higher, and

On the scene, Professor Qiu Guoming, a professor of the Department of Journalism and Communication at Beijing Normal University, and the President of the Chinese Media Economics and Management Special Committee, analyzed and interpreted the Report.

He said that in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has already transitioned from “consumer accessibility” to “consumer quality”, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the “hard currency” of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and handle of the new stage of e-commerce development. Knowledge payment, professional knowledge, KOL (Key Opinion Leaders) and other PGC content have begun to become the standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking forward to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Qiu Guoming put forward two suggestions.

One is to promote the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology from the perspective of improving the content structure, creating positive content creation and management standards, and realizing the dynamic balance of the system index of the e-commerce content ecology.
Another is to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value coordination and joint creation of the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry still needs more data and artificial intelligence support to form a stable prediction for future development; in addition, provide more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants, realize the value of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and jointly create a healthy content ecosystem.
(End)

(Deutsche Welle) The Biden administration on Friday (February 10) blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the balloon espionage program.
The U.S. Commerce Department said the five Chinese companies and one research institution helped modernize the Chinese military, particularly in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have a hard time getting U.S. technology exports.
The list, known as the "entity list," bars companies from buying technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they receive special export licenses from the Commerce Department.

The blacklisted companies are: Beijing Nange Kaitian Science and Technology Co., Ltd., China Electronics Technology Group 48th Research Institute, Longgang Lingkong Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., Yingmen Aviation Technology Group, Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Yingmen Aviation Technology Group.
The White House said earlier it was considering a broader range of measures to "expose and address" China's larger-scale surveillance activities that threaten U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has caused further tension between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down a balloon. The Chinese government made a solemn representation to the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously disrupting and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to stabilize Sino-US relations.

From the existing debris evidence and the information of the Chinese military's procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier of the Chinese military.

China's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Ma Xiaoguang said at a press conference on Friday that China has explained the situation and clarified its position on the accidental entry of a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle into the US airspace due to force majeure.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress is purely political manipulation and hype.
China is strongly dissatisfied with and resolutely opposes this.

"Today's action demonstrates our joint commitment to identify and disrupt China's use of spy balloons that have violated the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries," said Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary of commerce for export enforcement.
A worker at Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co. said he was unaware of the sanctions and declined to comment further, Reuters reported.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States and the Chinese Foreign Ministry have not commented on these messages.
(Reuters, etc.)

Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the rubble, and then found the father, but he insisted that they first save his son and another daughter.
The crowd cheered when they were all saved.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man were rescued from the rubble of a building that collapsed in the freezing cold.
“What day is it today?
" -- The boy, who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours, asked the rescuers who brought him back to the surface, "Why did you save me?"
A man in Kahramanmaras carries his cat after it was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building.
Miraculous success stories of rescues have brought a glimmer of hope to the already-dim hopes of the search and rescue operation, but at the same time, the number of casualties is rising.
According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts say people can survive more than a week after being trapped in rubble, hopes of finding more survivors are fading.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue effort began to shift to helping those who were in dire need of assistance.
UN official: Disaster in the region "unprecedented in a century"

The United Nations' undersecretary general for humanitarian affairs and emergency relief coordinator, Martin Griffiths, said at a press conference in Turkey that the earthquake was the "worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's response to the disaster as "unusual."
He also told a Reuters reporter that he hoped to be able to provide aid to areas controlled by the Syrian government and the opposition, but also said that the matter was "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in relief aid to people in Syria's earthquake-stricken areas.
The United Nations announced earlier this week that it would allocate $25 million in aid to Turkey and Syria.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Chilean Earthquake (1960)
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by humans occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a magnitude of 9.5.
In just 10 minutes, Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
A massive tsunami triggered by the earthquake hit the coast of Chile, with waves as high as 25 meters.
The tsunami also hit remote Japan and the Philippines.
The number of fatalities and economic losses caused by disasters of this magnitude are impossible to know with certainty .
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Alaska earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964, was a Friday, and it was Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history occurred in Alaska, USA, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until the 2006 Alaska earthquake, it was the third largest earthquake ever recorded.
When the earthquake struck, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate ruptured near Willow Bay, near the College Cove area.
The quake lasted from three to five minutes in most areas.
The seafloor displacement triggered a massive tsunami, with a height of 67 meters.
The school and many businesses were closed because it was a holiday.
The earthquake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while another 130 were killed by the tsunami it triggered.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above occurred in Tangshan, Hebei Province, China, and Fengnan County within 16 hours.
The earthquake was 23 kilometers below the surface.
Tangshan City's transportation, communication, water supply, and electricity were interrupted, and the city was leveled in an instant.
The capital city of Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, including Beijing and Tianjin, all the affected areas, the earthquake caused 242,769 deaths and 164,851 serious injuries.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second most deadly earthquake in China, second only to the 1556 Jiajing earthquake.
But some scientists abroad estimated that the earthquake could cause at least 650,000 deaths.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)

On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred 160 kilometers west of the Aceh province on the west coast of the island of Sumatra in Indonesia. The earthquake had a depth of 30 kilometers and a magnitude of 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a massive tsunami that reached heights of 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst-hit areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Thailand's Hua Hin and Phuket resorts, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu state in India.

The region was in the midst of its peak tourist season, with large numbers of visitors and locals in the area, which meant that many of the beachgoers and locals working on the coast were swept away by the tsunami, making the earthquake one of the deadliest in recent history.
At least 300,000 people are estimated to have died or gone missing.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
the Wenchuan earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a massive earthquake struck the Wenchuan region of Sichuan Province in China.

According to the data of China Earthquake Bureau, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2 and the moment magnitude reached 8.3, and the affected area was more than 100,000 square kilometers.
As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing persons, 374,643 injured, 1,993,030 homeless, and a total of 46,256,000 people affected.
It was the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China and the deadliest earthquake in the history of Tangshan.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as the Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Day, and that the education of the public and the attention paid to disaster prevention and mitigation work would be strengthened.
Since then, many Chinese governments and primary and secondary schools have held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Middle and primary schools also began to pay attention to the popularization of "earthquake prevention and disaster reduction" education.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, Haiti, a Caribbean island nation, was hit by an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0.
The epicenter was located 25 kilometers southwest of the Haitian capital Port-au-Prince, and the earthquake's epicenter was about 13 kilometers below the surface.
The International Red Cross estimates that about 3 million people have been affected by the earthquake.
The Haitian government has confirmed more than 200,000 deaths.
In some areas of Haiti, up to 90% of homes were destroyed in the earthquake.
Despite the massive aid and support provided by the international community, this poor and corrupt country with a population surplus has never recovered from the disaster.
The 60 most devastating earthquakes in the world since 1950
Japan’s East Northeast Earthquake (2011)
On March 11, 2011, a large earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 occurred off the coast of the Tohoku region in Japan.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the seismic source was measured to be 24 kilometers deep. A massive tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters was triggered.
This earthquake was the first to exceed magnitude 9 in Japan's history of observation.
About 22,000 people died, and some 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant suffered a meltdown after being hit by an earthquake and tsunami.
The incident was classified as the most serious of the seven levels on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident has led to the detection of trace amounts of radioactive material around the world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (half-life 30 years).
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident .
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster zones of Syria and Turkey are in urgent need of food.
In Syria alone, more than 5.3 million people have lost their homes due to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) has appealed for $77 million to provide food for people displaced by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
Temperatures in the disaster zone are as low as minus 10 degrees Celsius, and many people have no place to live.
The Turkish government has distributed large amounts of hot meals, tents and blankets, but the aid is still struggling to reach many of those in desperate need.
In Syria, where the civil war has raged for 12 years, the earthquake has added to the misery of the population.
In the four days since the earthquake, WFP has already provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for trauma treatment and emergency surgery.
(Associated Press, Reuters, etc.)

The victim entered the credit card information and verification code as instructed, and immediately received a notification from the financial institution that there were unknown charges on the credit card, and suspected that the credit card information was stolen by the above website.

2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website, so as to prevent theft;
3. Beware of fake websites and phishing websites, and always pay attention to whether the website address is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install and update antivirus software on your mobile phone, tablet, or computer regularly.
