Google AI chatbot “wrongly answers questions”; parent company’s stock price evaporates by $100 billion.
(Combined with the 11th day)

Google's new artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has suffered a setback with a "misstep" in a promotional video, causing Alphabet, Google's parent company, to plunge 8.9% on Thursday, falling below the $100 mark and wiping out $110 billion (RM476.5 billion) in market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is concerned that Alphabet is not as competitive as its rival Microsoft.

Google earlier this month released a promotional video on social media for its AI chatbot Bard, in which someone asks Bard: "What are some new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) that I can tell my 9-year-old about?"
"Bard mentioned in his answer that the telescope had taken the first photograph of an exoplanet.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration of the United States, the first photo of the exoplanet was taken by the Very Large Telescope of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported on the "Alphabet shares plunge after Bard's wrong answer."

On the other hand, Google said that Bard's response "demonstrates the importance of rigorous testing," and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's responses "meet high standards for quality, safety, and accuracy."
Singapore's tourism industry recovers strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times compared to 2021

(Comprehensive report on the 11th) Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore is expected to reach 12 million to 14 million in 2023, bringing tourism revenue of about 18 billion to 21 billion Singapore dollars; the number of tourists and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19
Singapore's tourism market will gradually restart and recover in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists in 2022 has increased 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the earlier estimate of 4 to 6 million by the Tourism Board, and tourists have already recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion Singapore dollars. It is estimated that the tourism revenue in 2022 will reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which is 6 to 7 times that of 1.89 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and has already recovered to about 50% to 52
The Singapore government is taking a multi-pronged approach to speed up the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced a nearly NZ$500 million allocation to stimulate the tourism industry's recovery.
The Tourism Board announced that it will allocate NZ$11 million from the budget over the next two years to launch more business and leisure activities to attract back tourists.

To make health and wellness one of Singapore's tourism highlights, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an expression of interest exercise on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness destination on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, executive director of sports and health tourism at the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health at the top of their list of considerations.

The development of a health and wellness destination in the southern coastal area of the Marina Bay, with the Marina Bay Gardens and the Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy, allowing visitors to spend more time in Singapore and stay longer.
Singapore Tourism Board chairman Chua Siew Leng said that in the next few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has increased public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
To this end, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness programs to the local public and international visitors over the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, offering the public more than 130 types of health activities and experiences.
Singapore will continue to offer new travel experiences for visitors.

In addition to the new Singapore Children's Museum, the Avatar World at Sentosa's Resorts World Sentosa, the "Explore New Frontiers" exhibit at the ArtScience Museum, and the new open-air theater at the Night Safari, the Tourism Board will support the development and updating of projects such as the Jurong Bird Park, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

Singapore will establish related industry standards for the sustainable development of the conference, exhibition and incentive travel industry by 2023, with a focus on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions, and further optimizing the travel environment.
Singapore's tourism recovery has accelerated the aviation recovery.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, the passenger flow at Changi Airport has recovered strongly, with more than 150,000 passengers per day, about 1 million per week, which is about 75% of the pre-pandemic level, and the number of airline employees has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

Data shows that from January to October 2022, Singapore has received 23.6 million visitors, equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic period, and 170,000 flights have taken off and landed, which is 53% of the pre-pandemic period.
The fast recovery of the tourism industry has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.

Singapore Tourism Board International Division Assistant Director Koh Su-dan said that a survey by Chinese travel platforms showed that Singapore’s safety index ranked among the top three in the world, which is one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular with Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, China had about 3.6 million people traveling to Singapore for vacation every year.
As China relaxes its border policies, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists this year will recover to 30% to 60% of the number in 2019.
Koo said that the Tourism Board will closely monitor the signals of China's further release of policies on outbound travel to cope with the changing needs of tourists.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies such as Ctrip, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to receive Chinese tourists in response to new trends in outbound travel from China.

Looking ahead to the 2023 travel market, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the travel industry will recover faster than expected, as long as there are no significant recessions affecting public income, and there are no new large-scale fatal outbreaks of the pandemic.

Q: How does Reignwood Investment view the January US non-farm employment data, which was much higher than expected, and the future trend?

A: On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data for January 2023, adding 517,000 non-farm employment, which was significantly higher than the market’s expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; the hourly wage growth rate was 4.4% year

In aggregate, there are a lot of one-time and technical factors that are distorting the data this month, such as the return to work of striking teachers, the adjustment of survey and statistical methodologies, and the updating of seasonal factors. These will likely be revised in the future (see the downward revision of nonfarm payrolls from 504,000 to 364,000 in January 2022),

In terms of structure, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still there, but it is relatively low; the employment of high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education and health care has increased significantly, and the data shows that the labor shortage in the service industry still exists.

Combining the recovery of the same unexpected service PMI, job vacancies and labor shortage data, and the strength of consumer credit data, we judge that the US service industry has experienced rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that without a recession, the tightness in the U.S. labor market is unlikely to improve.

Currently, the US labor market still has more than 5 million supply gaps, and the labor participation rate is slow to rise, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 year olds has approached the pre-epidemic high point.
Moreover, the strength of consumer demand will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market, given the strength of U.S. residential over-saving and consumer credit.
The tight supply and demand of the US labor market will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.

In the face of tight labor market and uncertain impact of tightening policies, we think the Fed's guidance on rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable, and the extreme expectations of the market and the crowded adjustment and trading may cause some harm to the market.

Founder of Shanshan Deng Yongjian died of sudden heart disease. He had led the transformation of China's first clothing stock - Economic Observer - professional financial news website

Economic Observer reporter Zheng Yixin: On February 11, the WeChat public account of Shu Shu Holdings Limited (hereinafter referred to as “Shu Shu Holdings”) issued an announcement that Shu Shu Enterprise founder and Shu Shu Holdings Chairman Zheng Yongqiang died on February 10, 2023, due to sudden heart disease, at the age of 6

In the 1980s, Zheng Yongqiang was the factory director of a state-owned cotton spinning mill. After being transferred, in 1989, Zheng Yongqiang became the factory director of Ningbo Yonggang Garment General Factory, the predecessor of Xinrui Group.

In December 2022, at the 20th China Enterprise Leaders Annual Meeting and the 22nd China Enterprise Future Stars Annual Meeting, Zheng Yongqiang said that in the 1990s, the market share of the Sun Sun brand in the Chinese suit market was as high as 37%.
Shanshan Holdings (600884.SH) was listed in 1996, becoming the first listed company in China's garment industry.

As the clothing business was booming, Sun Sun Group began to transform, because Zheng Yongqiang realized that "once the market is opened, Chinese brands will naturally form a ladder-like brand market, and Sun Sun Suit will not be able to continue to lead the trend and become the national suit for a long time. "

In 1999, Sun Sun began to study the transformation of enterprises. Zheng Yongqiang recalled that year, “We came to Shanghai, seeking to find out what the transformation is, and we specially invited many experts and scholars to hold a series of Zhuge Liang meetings and Xu Wei seminars.
Finally, we set two major strategic directions.

“Fund Account” has arrived: The CSRC authorizes the development of a system for the aggregation and query of all funds held by investors - Economic Observation Network - Professional financial news website
Economic Observer reporter Chen Xi: The complexity of the fund purchase channel makes it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the “little treasury”?
The problems of the Keminis are about to be solved.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the "Fund E Account" APP was uploaded and launched a public test in various mobile application stores.

The “Fund Account” provides a “one-stop” query service for individual investors to obtain information on public fund accounts and shares, which aims to solve the pain points of the industry, such as forgetting accounts and querying tediously.

According to Wind data, by the end of 2022, there were a total of 156 domestic public fund managers, managing fund assets of about RMB2.6 trillion; 167 public fund share registration institutions, and 411 public fund sales institutions.
The accounts system of each registration agency is independent, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.
Industry insiders said that at the end of 2021, China’s fund investors exceeded 72 million, which means that half of the country’s population invested in fund products.

Previously, investors needed to check their purchase status through different sales organizations, but through the "fund account", they can check the purchase status of all sales channels at a glance.
What is the “Fund Account” app?

According to the relevant documents, the “Fund Account” APP is a public fund industry portal mobile application developed and constructed by the China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the off-market shareholding of public fund products in the whole market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the holdings of the offshore shares of the publicly offered fund products of the fund managers through the "Fund Account", which can comprehensively improve the query efficiency.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through the “Fund Account” includes: the information of the fund account opened by the public fund managers in all the public fund managers in the market, the information of the trading account opened by the public fund sales institutions, and the situation of holding the offshore shares of the products such as the open-end fund, the collective asset management plan established by the securities company, and the number of investors is not

Liu Yicheng, the business director of Shanghai Securities Fund Rating Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can use the “Fund Account” app to know all their off-exchange publicly offered fund holdings at one stop, help them find “forgotten assets”, and more importantly, it has helped customers to collect comprehensive account information on fund investment, which helps customers to grasp their investment situation more timely, accur
How to register to use?

The reporter noticed that the “Fund E Account” app has been uploaded to the app stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, and vivo, but the app is still in the public test phase, and registration requires filling in an invitation code, and investors can contact the fund manager of the fund they hold to obtain it.

A customer service staff member from a large publicly-traded fund in Shanghai provided the reporter with a six-digit invitation code and told the reporter, “The APP is in the trial phase, and China Clearing provides each fund manager with a certain number of invitation codes, which investors can obtain by calling us, and we will provide them.
After the trial operation ends, the invitation code will be cancelled when the user registration is opened.

The reporter registered the account and completed the query by downloading and using the relevant documents of the “Fund Account” announced by the CSRC on its official website. The whole process only took a few minutes and was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund query.

After the step of real name authentication, click the “Assets” fund binding button, all the fund products purchased by the reporter through various fund sales platforms are displayed in the binding option list (can be bound account), and after binding is completed, the total assets of the fund invested can be directly seen and the query function can be started.
It is worth noting that the “fund account” only provides investors with query services, and cannot conduct redemption and purchase.
The data displayed in the “Fund E Account” is generally three trading days before the date of the user’s query (T day).

For example, on February 10, when you open the “Fund Account”, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to three trading days before that date, i.e., February 7.

Union mobilizes another anti-government retirement reform march
On Saturday (February 11), French unions launched a new nationwide mobilization against the government's pension reform draft, calling on people to take to the streets to express their opinions.
It is the fourth action day of the social trend against the draft reform of the government pension system.
How many people respond to the call for the rally may influence the next steps of the union.
It is the fourth time in a month that the eight major French trade unions have jointly launched a national mobilization, and the first time that the protests have been scheduled for a Saturday.

Given that Saturday is a day off for most French people, they do not need to choose between participating in the protests or going on strike, and the union groups therefore hope that today's gatherings will attract more people.

Unions representing workers at the transit system, the subway and the public railroad companies did not call for a strike today, meaning the transit system should be able to operate normally, allowing people to get to the rally and allowing people to travel to areas where schools are starting their winter break.
The unions hope to see more than a million people at the rally, while the police expect between 600,000 and 800,000 nationwide, with between 90,000 and 120,000 in the Paris region.

Since the start of the protests against the government's pension reform plan, although polls show that most French people do not support measures to delay the legal retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people taking to the streets has gradually decreased.
The first strike on January 31 brought together between 1.27 million and 2.5 million people across the country.
The crowds on Tuesday, February 7, had dwindled to between 757,000 and two million people nationwide.
The pension reform plan is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
Opposition parties, particularly those on the left, have submitted numerous amendments, which have slowed down the process.
The argument between the two sides is becoming more intense and sharp.

A member of the French Left Party, the Radical Left Party, recently posted a picture of himself on social media stepping on a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labor on it, which has provoked protests from the ruling party.
The National Assembly president ultimately announced that the lawmaker would be banned from parliamentary activities for 15 days as punishment for the behavior.

Despite the fact that this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France in more than 20 years, the government has so far made only minor adjustments to the draft and has not made any major concessions.

The union has already prepared to launch another action on Thursday, March 16, and it also plans to organize demonstrations on March 7, when the reform draft will be submitted to the Senate for discussion.

East Germany's last communist leader dies at 91
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "last night Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.

Four days after the Berlin Wall was opened on November 13, 1989, after 28 years of separation between East Berlin and West Berlin, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At the time, protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom, forcing the communist leaders from power.
Mikhail Gorbachev, after coming to power in the Soviet Union, demanded changes in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election results meant he was no longer prime minister.
Despite the reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay political changes and reunification, which occurred in October 1990.
He has also been criticized for attempting to reform rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Morales was found guilty of electoral fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but he did not go to jail.
He said the allegations were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Mr. Modrow continued to serve in the German Parliament, and from 1999 to 2004 he was a member of the European Parliament.
Modero sees himself as a reformer who wants to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want a return to the old East Germany, but said the achievements of the East should be recognized.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he served as a firefighter and, as the conflict was winding down, became a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi militia that conscripted men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles.
At 17, Modrow was captured by Soviet troops and taken to the Soviet Union, where he took courses in anti-fascism and became a committed communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found work as a mechanic, and continued his studies in social sciences and economics, earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a staff member of the Free German Youth movement, which was almost universal among East German young people, and rose to become chairman of the district party in Dresden between 1973 and 1989, under the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED).
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Mr. Modrow became East Germany's de facto leader, holding the top state post.

The crowd also chanted "Death to Israel."

Did the balloon incident make the US look better?
Strengthen restrictions on technology exports to China
According to a report by the Wall Street Journal today, the United States is preparing to further tighten its technology exports to China after the balloon incident.

Current and former security officials say the balloon incident underscores the national security threat posed by China and will help win more political support for strengthening U.S. technology protections.
The U.S. said the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communication.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior official of the US Central Intelligence Agency and now a senior fellow at the Washington think tank New America,
"This is undoubtedly adding fuel to the fire and supporting the view of the hardliners against China."

"We will also consider taking broader actions to expose and respond to China's larger scale surveillance activities that pose a threat to our national security and to our allies and partners," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters on Thursday.

"U.S. officials said they have briefed governments in more than 30 countries about the balloon incidents, underscoring the importance of international coordination in responding to the Chinese threat.

"The U.S. House of Representatives' new Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party could also put pressure on the U.S. to take more aggressive measures to slow down China's development," said Emily Benson, a senior fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
She said lawmakers will feel increasing pressure to take a harder line, which could force the White House to adopt a more aggressive policy.
The Wall Street Journal said that many people advocating stricter export controls are also pushing to expand the scope of controls to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The U.S. government has also been developing a foreign investment review program to examine whether U.S. investments abroad pose potential national security threats from China.
Analysts say the White House may face calls to move more quickly on the plan.
Syrian and Turkish rescue workers continue to search for survivors after a powerful earthquake hit the border region between the two countries.

Since the powerful earthquake that struck Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have worked tirelessly in the rubble of thousands of collapsed buildings to dig out survivors buried under the debris.
In the cold, they often call for silence, as they strain to hear any sign of life from the crumbling concrete piles.
Two more women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake days after the disaster, Reuters reported today.
But the death toll from the earthquake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has recorded 20,665 deaths, while Syria has recorded more than 3,500 deaths.

The 7.8-magnitude earthquake that struck Turkey and Syria on Monday has been followed by several strong aftershocks, and is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by the 2003 earthquake in neighboring Iran.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.

Two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake to hit the region in two decades, Turkish authorities said on Saturday, as rescuers pulled the women from the rubble of collapsed buildings.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In the cold, rescuers often call for silence as they strain to hear any sign of life from the rubble of the crumbling concrete.
In Samandag, Turkey, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" -- "God willing" -- as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opens his eyes and sees the baby, Yagiz Ulas, wrapped in a blanket, being carried into the field hospital.
Video footage shows that paramedics also took away his mother, who was unconscious and pale-faced but lucid on the stretcher.
Turkey's Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, with 31,000 rescuers deployed to the affected areas.
He said that around 80,000 people were receiving treatment in hospitals, while 1.05 million were homeless and living in temporary shelters.
As many people lack food under the cold winter conditions, the public is increasingly questioning the two leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has visited a hospital in Aleppo with his wife Asma, state media reported, saying it was the first time he had visited a disaster area since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said it was running out of stocks in northwestern Syria, which is controlled by rebels, because the war situation had made the delivery of aid complicated.
On Friday, Erdogan visited Adiyaman province in Turkey, where he admitted that the government's response had not been as fast as it should have been.
Opponents seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking a new term in office in a May 14 vote that could be delayed by the disaster.
The anger over the delayed aid and the start of the rescue operation could affect the election, Reuters said.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's two-decade rule.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called "negative moves for political interests."
Turkey's main opposition leader, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, criticized the government's response.
"The earthquake was big, but the lack of coordination, the lack of planning and the incompetence are more serious than the earthquake," the criticism said.

Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha highly praised the establishment of the University of Malaya’s first branch in Vietnam, believing that the university’s development scale in the region and the world will be increasingly strong; and further expanding cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
The prime minister and his wife planted a commemorative tree and left a message in the guest book at the university campus.

Prime Minister Prayut Wongsuwan congratulated the University of Malaya on its continuous development and its increasing contribution to the education sector in Malaysia, and expressed his hope that the university would continue to expand its cooperation with educational and training institutions in Vietnam.

What was the "object" shot down over Alaska?
I'm confused, I'm guessing
The U.S. military on Friday afternoon again used its most advanced stealth fighter, the F-22, to shoot down an unidentified object flying over Alaska.
The crash site is about 10 miles from the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an aerial object.
A Chinese spy balloon drifted over the United States for days before it was shot down off the coast of South Carolina on Saturday.

The Pentagon said the second object shot down entered U.S. airspace on Thursday night, was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved over northern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car and much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also said there was no indication that the object was maneuverable.

The object, which was flying at high altitude, was "a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aircraft," said John Kirby, the strategic communications coordinator for the National Security Council at the White House, on Friday.
Kobe said that this object is different from the spy balloon found in the United States, and it does not have a "payload" hanging on it.
"We call it an 'object' because that's the best description we can give it at the moment," said Kobe.
"He was very careful in making that decision," Cobie added, noting that President Biden had taken the advice of the Pentagon before ordering the strike.

The official description of the object from the US authorities can be roughly summarized as follows: the size is about that of a small car, it has no joystick, no suspension, and a flight altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But this information does not answer the basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what its mission is.
Many online analyses and speculations suggest that it could be another Chinese balloon.
It may have come from China, like the spy balloon that invaded US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, performing some sort of mission.
Some have linked the Alaska "object" to unidentified flying objects (UFOs).
"I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO," former U.S. Rep. Peter Meijer tweeted on Friday.
"The irony of mixing alien spacecraft with weather balloons is surprising, but it's not worth triggering an intergalactic conflict," Magee said.
MJ tweeted this shortly after Kobe confirmed the Alaska object was shot down.
The Weekly News said that it was not just Megahy who doubted that the object was a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett criticized the government's practice of withholding information last month, demanding that the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) release a report on "unidentified aerial phenomena."

I don't recommend reading it.
I read it a long time ago, and I just saw it again by chance.
This book is not a collection of short stories, but a collection of fragments of life about love.
The tone of the book is very flat, like plain water, and the words and phrases are very simple, and the plot is as quiet and calm as the streets in the afternoon of summer.
Each of the short stories is a fragment of ordinary life, without a beginning or an end.
The result is a collection of essays titled What We Talk About When We Talk About Love.

I think this collection of short stories, and its title, is a kind of art of behavior, the author wants to express that love is not only the stage of joy and sorrow, the urban legend of the hard and rough, nor is it only the glue and paint of you and me, love is not only the above, and should not be represented by the above, love is also the life of the plain and the water, the dry and tasteless day after day, and the
As you read this book, you may recall the fights you've had with your spouse, the acquaintances you know who are in loveless marriages, and the relationships that just aren't working.

This is why I don't recommend reading it, aesthetically speaking, the writing and plot are bland, unless your life is a rollercoaster or a candy castle, you'll feel like you're reading something that's not weird or boring.

And, in terms of depth of thought, the everyday scenarios are not particularly illuminating or expansive (unlike Malcolm's "The Age of Innocence"), and the brief snippets of conversation don't address any issues, such as what kind of mistakes lead to failed relationships.
What are the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn't matter much.
The author's ideas are expressed more through technique and form than story, which is why the reading experience is less than ideal.
It is suitable for rough reading, but not for detailed reading.
The book is well-logical, but not enough content.
It explains what and why many sales theories, but it is weak in how to do it, it only points out the direction but does not give specific practice.
Also, the book feels like it was pieced together.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign; both well-known entrepreneurs or salesmen and unknown people.
I don't know if it's a story written for the sake of example, and if it's more convincing if some cases are written by the author.
The terms "customer" and "client" have been used interchangeably.
The title is still the customer, but the main text has become the customer.
The eBook also had problems with misspellings, missing punctuation, and incorrect numbering.
In summary, this book is a good choice as an introduction to the theory, but it is not suitable for people who have already engaged in sales and want to improve their sales level.
A Quick Guide to Internet Finance

This book is shallow, it can be said that it is only an introduction, and it can help you quickly understand the overall situation of Internet finance, but to understand it in depth, you still have to follow the map and dig it yourself.

And the book was written earlier, and the later WeChat Pay subsidy war to cultivate user habits has not yet been mentioned, and the current share of third party payments is probably not as small as the proportion mentioned in the book.
Now many people take their mobile phones with them when they go out to eat, and merchants have also abandoned UnionPay because of the high bank flow.

But I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introduction book, which shows that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the financial development history at home and abroad, so it can write such popular and easy-to-understand content.
It is easy to write high and lofty, but difficult to write simple and easy to understand.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know!
The first factor in determining job satisfaction is not the level of pay, but whether the employee is given enough respect and recognition for the work they do.

According to Maslow’s hierarchy of needs, after the basic survival needs of human beings are satisfied, the most urgent is the satisfaction of psychological needs - the hope of being understood, recognized and appreciated.
Indeed, for the Chinese people, most of them are “hard to say I love you” in their mouths, even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their hearts and not say it out loud.
In this book, the author explains five languages of appreciation: words of affirmation, acts of service, receiving gifts, quality time, and physical touch.

I think the important thing is not to know what the five languages of appreciation are, but to be able to use them at any time, anywhere, to appreciate and be grateful to the people around you, whether they are family, friends or colleagues.
In fact, the more intimate people are, the more they need praise and gratitude, so that our lives will become more beautiful.
Learning to praise can also help companies retain talent to a certain extent and reduce the resignation rate.
I would like to thank the translators for bringing us the wonderful foreign ideas and the world.

Due to the differences in cultural backgrounds between the East and the West, there are differences between the two languages, and if you have the opportunity to see the original version, I believe you will gain more.

The worst shopping experience ever

On the night of September 23, my wife dropped her phone. I immediately ordered an 8p from Malaysia on Amazon. It was in stock but not self-owned and did not increase the price (secretly happy). Because it was not self-owned, the delivery was slower, and the system showed that the delivery was expected to arrive on September 27th.

My wife was so upset that she didn’t have a phone, so she called me at 6:30 in the morning to think about it, and then she went to JD.com to see if there was any 256G stock that could be delivered the same day, so she immediately ordered another one.
I just bought it and I was thinking of cancelling my Amazon order.

Because the order was placed at midnight, it was impossible to receive the delivery at dawn. I called the customer service at 7:30 to cancel the order, and the customer service replied that the order had been canceled, and I should wait for the text message notification.

Okay, I'll wait patiently, and when I check my phone at noon, the order is still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contact customer service to ask them to cancel the order as soon as possible, and the customer service replied that it has been operated OK.

I checked my phone at 3 pm and the order was still there, so I had to contact customer service again to clarify that I had already called three times and asked them to cancel the order and inform the seller that the package must not be sent!

The customer service contacted the seller on my request, and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system, and that I should wait until the seller was familiar with the system before cancelling the order.
But I was explicitly told by the seller that they knew and that they would not ship.
I checked the order status on Monday and it said it had been shipped, I was speechless.
Unable to contact the seller directly, I called customer service again.
The after-sale service is simply unspeakable, basically I say one step, and the customer service only operates one step.
The order is still in the rejected state, and is being prepared to be sent again!
Wouldn't Amazon be following up?
The seller’s company had already received the money, so it didn’t matter if they followed up or not.
In conclusion, I will never prepay for large items again, this is too much hassle.
